solution_line_template: If Eugene used all but {cards_not_used} of the {total_cards} cards, then he used {total_cards}-{cards_not_used}=<<{total_cards}-{cards_not_used}={cards_used}>>{cards_used} cards.

If for every card he used {toothpicks_per_card} toothpicks, then a box of toothpicks would have enough toothpicks for {toothpicks_per_box}/{toothpicks_per_card}=<<{toothpicks_per_box}/{toothpicks_per_card}={cards_per_box}>>{cards_per_box} cards.

Since one box has enough toothpicks for {cards_per_box} cards, then for {cards_used} cards he would need {cards_used}/{cards_per_box}=<<{cards_used}/{cards_per_box}={boxes_needed}>>{boxes_needed} boxes of toothpicks.
